Replies.Reply: Know what the problem is, kid?   You're too ugly to get propositioned.
Next week we work the park.
You will, one day at a time.   I'll be old and grey when it happens...
Hell, I got a gold watch... it just don't work. Maybe they'll give me a new fishing pole, or something useful.
How hard can it be? The grand kids been buggin' me about taking them camping.
One of these days you're gonna get tired of fighting the shit. When that happens, you'll wish you had family.
Why don't you just shoot it and put it out of its misery?
I thought you said what's-her-name's brother was going to fix it.
We're vice, I didn't see no pimps or hookers in that van. But if you're so gung-ho, we'd best call it in for some back-up.
Take your time... one day at a time, kid...
It's all I got... it's yours.
I gotta get back on top.   Get off the sleaze detail.
So what'll you do? After they give you the gold watch.
You outta the city... that's a fish out of water. What's with all this family talk lately, anyway?
No thanks.   I got close but it never woulda worked.
What are you talking about, it's purring like a kitty.
She didn't work out, had to cut her loose.
She wanted to cook me breakfast.
Nah, let's just take a look-see.
Tell them to drop it - now!
Looks like the stuff my dad used to use to blow up tree stumps back in Scranton.
I'm looking for the Bomb Squad.
Off a girl's wrist.    A suspect...
It's detonation cord, for a bomb.
Look, I saw these guys, I can i.d. them.
We just got a bomb threat upstairs.
A cop was killed last night interrupting a robbery. One of the gang was grabbed, a girl.
We can start in the area where the robbery occurred.
Captain assigned me to assist you.
We've got one hour.     Are you coming or not?
What kind of bomb was it?
So you're the "Device Squad"... and you defuse "devices"?
I'm sorry, detective, but you're just not my type.
Where's the girl? The one I brought in.
Captain said I could give it a crack.
She was my collar. Maybe I'll get lucky.
You know, your boyfriend just killed a ten year old at a bus stop, blew her head clean off.
You're scared. You're just caught in the middle. But, we've got a guy out there wasting people just to get you back. Why? It can't be because of your looks. So, I'll be honest with you -

Let me be very clear about this. The police won't let you go. When your boyfriend realizes this, I have a feeling a lot of innocent people are going to die. Kids, families. I know you don't want that to happen.
She's not talking. But, she could be. So, obviously, you've seen one of these devices before?
All of you, shut the fuck up!
No wonder the rest of the department doesn't want to work with you. You're nothing but a bunch of... punks.
The place has already be combed. Forensics pulled over a hundred sets of prints inside.
I don't know. You tell me?
Cream of the crop, huh?   You?
Just how easy is it to build a... device?
Girl was here. The guy in charge was over there with one of his men, the other one was back there.
Bombers, what kettle of fish are they?
Except they'll blow you up if you don't play along.
Nitro-cellulose. What is that, some kind of explosive?
You mean you just--? ... You keep a record of... matches?
Reilly's attention is drawn to a crowded booth in the corner where a few bowling alley girls block the view of the entire booth.
What not bad. You've got a series of bombs, devices, that may or may not be connected, set by one or many nutjobs, who may or may not be linked.
Well... it's more than we had ten minutes ago.
Still waiting for a miracle.   Go ahead.
Quite a team you've got, where'd you find them?
There he goes. He was here the whole time.
Say, thanks for the back up--
You heard him, get the fuck away, it's a bomb!
Got work to do, don't we?
Report on the case so far.
Meg clears the dishes, Schnoz is asleep on the floor. Glass and Reilly are left alone.   Reilly takes a sip of coffee, hand trembles ever so slightly.
Pittsburgh, two years ago. Partner died, no back-up, I was too gung-ho. As usual.

I know. I was working a drug ring, deep cover. Played the part too well. When they pulled me out, I wasn't a cop anymore. My fiance had dumped me. Next thing I knew, I was out here on the street, doped up, auditioning for the morgue when this tough old vice cop found me, cleaned me up, gave me a second chance. He promised Captain Winters he'd look out for me.
I guess I didn't realize how much I needed him. He kept me straight. It's been tough every second since.
This was his. Doesn't work for shit, but it's keeping me straight.
I didn't.     But I had to try.
Excuse me... I'm looking for two men who were staying at the hotel over there - one has a beard, the other's tall, thin. You wouldn't happen to have seen them, would you?
No, of course not... well, thanks anyway. Here you go, Your Highness.
My God, you're going to use her, aren't you?
I promised her she'd be safe.
It won't work, he'll know it's a trap...
Patch me through to the Bomb Squad.
T.J., it's Reilly, put Glass on!
Catch that alert? That's him in the U-Haul.
Cuz he got the girl, now he's leaving town.
Glass, Eighth Street, alley behind Grand Hotel. Cut him off.
All units, suspect spotted heading down alley behind Grand Hotel.
Fire me later. Close in and we got the bastard.
We'll keep him pinned in, you guys hurry up!
Glass, you guys take cover, goddammit!
C'mon, talk to me! We can do it!
How the hell do you feel yellow?
A small gift, sir, for the Queen ...
I keep a record, see? They don't pay, I don't forget.
On second thought, maybe I did.
Lemme see... yeah, here it is, 11:18 this morning. Very disrespectful. He used to drive a van, but he got a new car. You want the license number?
You have no idea how sorry you're going to be.
I want her back and we do the job.
You hungry?     We could get something to eat.
We're moving' on. I have to pick up the supplies. Just two little boxes.
I want out, right now.      Or the whole city block is gone.
Besides, we're on a schedule and the cops won't let her go.
Hey, beautiful, can I buy you some bangers and mash? Pint of Guiness?
Last chance. You know, even the smallest choices in life could change everything.
Hey, Reilly, Captain's looking for you.
She won't talk. Look at this shit, no I.D., nothing...
Tough? Tough is "Fuck you, where's my lawyer?". This chick doesn't say boo.
She ain't no hooker.   This is a murder investigation.
Ran the license plate - car was rented early this morning from a Hertz office downtown.
Reilly, what the hell happened out there?   Why didn't you call for back-up?
home and clean yourself up, get some rest...
Take it down to the Bomb Squad, Artie-
Okay, kid.    Run this down to the Cave.
We can't take the chance. Ring down to the Bomb Squad. I want them on alert.
I know you're anxious to get back but... just stay out of homicide's way or I'll have you classifying fingerprints, understand?
Can it, Pluchinsky. And shove some cotton up your nose.
Let's go, we gotta jump on him the second he calls again.
Look, we're prepared to talk, what do you want--?
Section commanders, in my office, now.
You know after a shooting I would normally take your badge and weapon, but Glass called in already and confirmed it was clean.
But from now on, any leads on this case go to Pluchinsky. He's primary investigator and you are unofficially assigned to the Bomb Squad...
I imagine as soon as they find out one of their's is dead, we'll be getting another call. So get some sleep, alright.
Yes ... no, of course not but ... yes, sir, I understand.
I got a call from upstairs. They say you questioned the girl.
She's refused to say a word to anyone. What made you think you could get her to talk?
I read your report. Impressive. I'd say it's got detective written all over it. But... you cross the line one more time... you're gone.
Now, that out of the way. The girl wants to talk to you, alone.
So get going, let's close this thing.
Jesus. Pluchinsky, get four squad cars out to my house, get my family out of there, tell my wife I'm on my way.
Glass, sorry about Pooch, he was a good man.
Glass, you're to stand by with your team.
Reilly, you're done for now. What the hell were you thinking directing the Bomb Squad Team into hot pursuit. They had no business-
You've been at the center of two suspect fatalities and two Police Officer fatalities.
How do we know you'll keep your word?
Reilly, what the hell are you-?
Pull back.   You're only an observer.
Just want you wanted. Your promotion, and transfer.
Lab's backed up, we're still waiting for it.
You're vice, not homicide. Besides, you don't have the experience and you're too personally involved.
Maybe she knows your old man.
It's a bluff. The guy's full of crap.
I said get the fuck outta here.
And what, you'll shoot me? Hey, don't mistake me for one of your partners, I'd like to make retirement in one piece.
Son-of-a-bitch... my nose...   This fuck-up is interfering with-
I'm filing charges against that mother-
You were lucky today, vice boy. Captain said to leave it alone, but just remember, I'm watching you.

Alex Swan - demolitions expert, trained at Redstone, dropped out, freelanced in the middle East for awhile, then disappeared, no criminal record. The other one, Leveau, is French Canadian, he's a mercenary, record in half a dozen countries.
Get out and go to the machine shop -
There out on a call, perhaps I can help you-

No, honey, I'm fine. Yeah, well, you're welcome. You deserve flowers more often.

Nitro, dash of Semtrex, vegetable oil ...
Good boy, Schnoz. Daddy loves you.

Awright!   How bout you, Glass, how's that chip shaking?

Exactly my thinking. Except, none of the targets can actually be linked to government, political or special interest concerns. They seem to be just unrelated industrial companies.   Some insured, some not.
But there's traces of C4 and assorted inflammatory additives found in each case.

I got a friend over at Scotland Yard who's gonna try and reach out to a undercover guy who would know if any of the rightwingers are circulating over here. Bev's following up on the briefcase manufacturers, too.
I don't know, honey. I'll see. No, everything's fine, it was nothing.

Time for bed, kiddos.   Say goodnight.
Nothing.    Maybe they gave up, split town.

High-grade det cord. This girl, either she's got strange taste in jewelry or she's into serious demolition.
That's an inch of the stuff, imagine what the whole thing'd do.
Look, nothing personal, but you can't just waltz in here and expect to join the team.
When you need us, you love us, when you don't, we're shunned by the rest of the department.
Call upstairs, see what you can find out.
T.J., run a trace on this, see if you can pin down where it came from. Whoever these people are, let's hope they're all talk.
Hope you don't mind, Captain, might help us catch these guys that much sooner.
That cop who bought it... you didn't tell us he was your partner.
Let's get something straight. We're doing you a favor. You're not exactly a guy we want around explosives.
This isn't bumper cars, it's brain surgery.
Be cool around my men, they don't trust strangers. And try not to swear so much, it's unattractive.
By the way, I'm Glass.   This is T.J., and Pooch.
We don't use the b-word.      Bad luck.
Unlikely. Probably, cash register or something.
What can you tell us about the girl with the exploding jewelry?

I.R.A. device. Deadliest class of tickers in existence. Computerized, multiple sensors, booby traps, the works. First showed up in a series of I.R.A. bombings in London couple years ago. One of their boys tripped it on himself and they went back to a less complicated timers. The Girl, is she Irish?
Relax, Pooch, it's just a ticker, it's not personal.
Nice performance back there. Where'd you learn that, Mike Ditka Sensitivity Seminar?
No you look, mister! First, you don't go calling my men names. It's bad for morale.
Then let's go see what they missed.
So what were they doing here?
An abandoned machine shop... nice place to build devices. Low rent, too. But, you and Rice ruined their perfect hideout.
Redstone's the army training center in Alabama where they send the cream of the crop to learn about tickers.
Top of my class at West Point, thank you very much. Then off to Redstone. First half of the course we learned how to build devices...

There were a few guys in my class with names like John Smith, Bill Jones. I'd see them up ahead in the hall, call their name, but they wouldn't turn around. C.I.A. Funny thing, they'd always disappear after the first half of the course.
With a little training, you could go into a house and just from stuff in the bathroom and kitchen make something that'd finish off that alleged car of yours. Heck, didn't you ever watch MacGyver?
So this is where it happened.
Typical profile, usually losers, nobodies that're afraid to confront their victims.

No, ninety-ninety percent of them are full of baloney. They're into the power trip, not the damage. What scares me is that this guy is so sophisticated he could blow up whatever he wants, then disappear. The worst of the bunch, they love the challenge of creating the wildest device ever... and they love the carnage.
French. Doubt somebody who worked here smoked it. Only half gone, put it out in a hurry.

alleys they supply in this area.

there's that one second when you realize you saw something you weren't supposed to see...

Too easy. There's gotta be something else in there, another cap maybe.

Okay, one of the caps turns it on, the other shuts it down.
